alert.note: Alert for Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 11:33PM EST until February 18 at 4:45PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers... North Fork Licking River at Newark Main Street. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Licking River at Newark Main Street. * WHEN...From this evening to Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor flooding of lowland areas near the North Fork continues with backwater flooding into some low spots of the Owens Corning property. Flooding continues at Wildcat Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 PM EST Thursday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will crest near 16 feet early Friday morning. The river will fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
